etymology.description: semantic: 月(月) (yuè, "flesh") + phonetic: 匈(匈) (xiōng) = part of the body related to flesh -> chest
etymology.interpretation: The character 胸(xiōng) combines 月(月) (yuè, "flesh"), which indicates the character relates to a part of the body, with 匈(匈) (xiōng), which provides the phonetic element. This suggests a focus on a body part, specifically the chest.

examples.chinese: 他的胸中充满勇气(他的胸中充滿勇氣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xiōng zhōng chōngmǎn yǒngqì.
examples.english: His chest is full of courage.

examples.chinese: 他坚持锻炼(他堅持鍛鍊)，以增强胸的力量(以增強胸的力量)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiānchí duànliàn, yǐ zēngqiáng xiōng de lìliàng.
examples.english: He insists on exercising to strengthen the power of his chest.

examples.chinese: 医生检查了他的胸(醫生檢查了他的胸)。
